intro: Guardiola platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leaved guardiola, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its broad, flat leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid environment. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pale pink to white, typically blooming during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Guardiola platyphylla is considered a species of conservation concern.
